com.elsevier.xml

Class XQueryProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.elsevier.xml.XQueryProcessor

  • public class XQueryProcessor
extends java.lang.Object
    Class with static methods to apply an XQuery expression against a string of arbitrary content or against an object in an S3 bucket.
    Author:
    Darin McBeath

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init()
        Init the SimpleStorageService.

      • init

        public static void init(java.lang.String bucket,
        java.lang.String key)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Init the SimpleStorageService and NamespaceContext. Set the prefix to namespace mappings specified in the object contained in the S3 bucket. The object in S3 should contain one namespace prefix to namespace uri mapping per line. Within this line, the namespace prefix must precede an "=" and the namespace uri must follow the "=".
        Parameters:
        bucket - S3 bucket containing the file with the namespace prefix to namespace mappings
        key - Key for the file with the namespace prefix to namespace mappings
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • clear

        public static void clear()
        Clear the S3 client and the namespace prefix uri mappings. Useful if you want to reset the AWS credentials are use a different set of namespace mappings.

      • evaluateBucketKey

        public static java.lang.String evaluateBucketKey(java.lang.String bucket,
                                 java.lang.String key,
                                 java.lang.String xqueryExpression)
        Apply the xqueryExpression to the content identified in the S3 bucket and return a serialized response.
        Parameters:
        bucket - S3 bucket containing the content to which the xqueryExpression will be applied
        key - identifier for the content in the S3 bucket to which the xqueryExpression will be applied
        xqueryExpression - XQuery expression to apply to the content
        Returns:
        Serialized response from the evaluation

      • evaluateString

        public static java.lang.String evaluateString(java.lang.String content,
                              java.lang.String xqueryExpression)
        Apply the xqueryExpression to the specified string and return a serialized response.
        Parameters:
        content - String to which the xqueryExpression will be applied
        xqueryExpression - XQuery expression to apply to the content
        Returns:
        Serialized response from the evaluation
